result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Sarah J. Hagen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sarah J. Hagen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Sarah J. Hagen was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 3:11 p.m. Defendant Sarah J. Hagen in court with attorney Thomas Garrett Wilmouth.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss based on defendant's compliance - Granted. Adj. 3:12 p.m.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
1:32 p.m. Defendant Sarah J. Hagen in court with attorney Thomas G. Wilmouth.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in receipt of Sentencing Memorandum/Plea Questionnaires. Michlig speaks to agreement. State motions to amend Ct. 3 in 14CF175 to 961.573(1) poss. drug paraphelia, msd.; amend Ct. 2 in 14CF213 to 450.11(7)(h), msd. and dismiss all remaining counts. Court grants amendments and dismisses Cts. 1 & 3 in 14CF213 and Ct. 2 in 14CF175.  Defendant pleads guilty to Ct. 1 and amended Ct. 3 in 14CF175 and Ct. 2 in 14CF213. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea; waiver free and voluntary. Court finds factual basis for plea exists and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 2 in 14CF213/Ct. 3 in 14CF175; Court defers entry on Ct. 1 in 14CF175. Michlig/Wilmouth/Hagen statement to sentencing. Court statement. Court questions state on deferment. Michlig statement - moves to amend DEJ document to reflect 2 yrs. DNA expungement info. provided.

Court sentencing
14CF175 - Ct. 1 - DEJ for 2 yrs.
Successfully complete probation on 2 msd. offenses
Succussfully complete aftercare program/treatment
Random drug testing
Successfully complete parenting classes

14CF175
Ct. 3 as amended
WHS
POP 2 yrs.
CC/CV/Supervision fees
DNA surcharge
DNA sample

14CF213 - concurrent to Ct. 3 in 14CF175
Ct. 2 as amended
WHS
POP 2 yrs.
3 days' credit
CC/CV/Suervision fees
DNA sample
Appeal rights

11:05 am - Defendant Sarah J. Hagen in court with attorney Thomas G. Wilmouth.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf175 and 14cf213.  Michlig states parties have engaged in discussions to resolve cases - very close to resolution.  Adjournment requested.  Bail continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

02:02 pm - Defendant Sarah J. Hagen in court with attorney Thomas G. Wilmouth.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf175 and 14cf213.  Schiek states Michlig and Wilmouth are in negotiations - joint request for another pretrial conference.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 10, 2015 at 10:45 am.

02:52 pm - Defendant Sarah J. Hagen in court with attorney Thomas G. Wilmouth.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also calling 14cf175 (STC).  In 14cf213 - In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived.  Wilmouth requests pretrial conference date for both cases.  
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on November 17, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Sarah J. Hagen in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
